Hi Vincent,

I was very interested when I've seen the table of contents of your 
book... we're starting to automatize tests at my company and we have 
a lot of doubts in designing tests strategies... I've bought a book 
from O'Reilly, Java Extreme Programming Cookbook, that was very 
helpful with JUnit but still doesn't cover it as deeply as I want...

I've subscribed the mailing list, but I haven't seen any link to 
download the PDF first chapter... will it be sent to me later?

Thanks,
Leonardo Barros


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Vincent Massol" <vmassol@p...> wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I'm happy to announce that my JUnit in Action book is now available
> through the Manning Early Access Programme (MEAP). This means that 
you
> can subscribe to it and get the chapters in PDF format as they are
> published (first chapter is already published, 2 others will be
> published tomorrow and other chapters will be posted at a rate of 1 
per
> week).
> 
> More information about the book and MEAP is available at
> http://www.manning.com/massol/
> 
> Here's some information about the book (taken from the book's
> back-cover):
> 
> Developers in the know are switching to a new testing strategy - 
unit
> testing - which interleaves coding and testing in an integrated way.
> This has proven to be a powerful combination that results in better
> designed software with fewer defects and faster delivery cycles. 
> 
> JUnit in Action shows you how to benefit from this strategy using 
the
> popular open source testing framework, JUnit. It's a no fluff 
discussion
> of unit testing techniques and best practices. It gives examples of
> tough situations such as how to unit test EJBs, database 
applications,
> JSPs and Taglibs. It discusses unit testing of J2EE applications, 
and
> shows how to test in automated builds.
> 
> What's Inside:
> - Unit testing best practices
> - Testing in isolation with mock objects 
> - In-container testing with Cactus 
> - Automated builds with Ant and Maven 
> - Unit testing from within Eclipse 
> - Test Driven Development principles 
> - Unit testing 
>   - Java apps 
>   - Servlets 
>   - JSP 
>   - Taglibs 
>   - Filters 
>   - EJB 
>   - DB apps
> 
> Note that the book can also pre-ordered from Amazon
> (http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-
/1930110995/qid=1057695644
> /sr=8-1/ref=sr_8_1/104-1481474-9343103?v=glance&s=books&n=507846).
> 
> Feel free to ask any question.
> 
> Thanks
> -Vincent
